_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Environmental Protection Agency - Risk Management Plan Allen Station RMP Executive Summary



DESCRIPTION OF STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES: 

Powder Springs Logistics is butane storage and blending terminal which stores butane and blends into refined products pipelines.  The 40 CFR 68 regulated substance at this facility is butane. These activities require compliance with the PSM and RMP regulations as greater than 10,000 lbs are stored onsite. The equipment which handles butane includes two pressure vessels, ten injection pumps and associated piping. The butane pressure vessel and associated piping may contain as much as 27,821,556 lbs of butane. 



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES: 

Powder Springs Logistics has a strong commitment to worker and public safety, along with resources invested in accident prevention, such as training personnel and contractors in design, installation, operations and maintenance procedures. If an emergency were to occur, it is our policy to notify the Cobb County Police and Fire (LEPC) and request that they respond to the emergency. 



GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND MAINTENANCE PROGRAM: 

The regulated butane storage/blending process in the facility is compliant with the fourteen (14) elements of Process Safety Management and other employee training programs, along with operating and maintenance procedures. The process controls listed in Section 7.4e were chosen based on whether or not they were used as safeguards in the last PHA for this facility or if they were recommended from the latest PHA and installed prior to the RMP submittal. There may be other process controls in this facility that were not identified as safeguards in the last PHA. The facility has no "Trade Secrets". The facility complies with the Federal and State requirements for leak detection of valves, pumps, and flanges. Inspections are conducted and documented to ensure the integrity of the regulated equipment.

FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY 

Powder Springs Logistics had a butane release in the summer of 2020 due to human error.  This incident necessitated a facility evacuation and a shelter-in-place situation for the neighboring industrial facility. 

There were no injuries or fatalities.  A thorough incident investigation identified several improvement opportunities. These items have been completed.  



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM 

The facility is considered a non-responding facility.  However, it maintains a written Emergency Response Plan. In the event of fire or explosion, or a release of a regulated substance from the process, entry within the distance to the specified endpoint may pose a danger to public emergency responders. Therefore, emergency responders should not enter the area except as arranged with the emergency contact indicated within the RMP. The undersigned certifies that to the best of my knowledge, information, and belief, the information submitted is true, accurate and complete. 



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY 

Powder Springs Logistics continually reviews its operations, procedures, equipment and risks for improvement opportunities.  As opportunities are identified, they will be evaluated by the owner (Powder Springs Logistics) and/or the operator (Magellan Midstream Partners, L.P.) and implemented if warranted.
